intro: Diplostephium sessiliflorum, commonly known as the sessile-flowered diplostephium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its herbaceous growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
